titleInfo.title: Letter from L C A Scote [Scott?], 11 Northumberland Terrace, Primrose Hill, London to Lewis Pelly

mods.abstract: Letter regarding Alfred Hyman Louis and his wife Elizabeth and their recent emigration to Melbourne, Australia which has been caused by recent events in England and Mr Louis not being able to work in England. The letter discusses the difficulties for Mrs Louis in leaving her circle of friends and family behind in England.The letter also discusses Louis's recently published book England and Europeand refers to various reviews in the newspapers including the Spectatorand the National Review.The letter concludes by reporting on an account of Pelly's travels through Central Asia which appeared in The Times,giving his concerns over the remoteness of Pelly's latest appointment, his hopes that he is simply biding his time for a more suitable appointment, and giving news of the recent marriage of their friend John Savill Vaizey.
